channel.title: Intel with ATI
channel.description: Everyone tells me that ATI and Intel is a bad mix, that somehow it doesn't work well together. I've never been able to find anything that actually proves it. Anyone care to tell me why, or show me some proof? I've always gone with Intel and ATI and I have had no problems with it.

item.title: Intel with ATI
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“llib, post:24, topic:284038”][quote author=the bank link=topic=375398.msg2835303#msg2835303 date=1245609792]

AMD n’ Nvidia ftw.

Who says you have to go Intel/Nvidia?
[/quote]Because Intel > AMD

Right but Intel makes sure you pay for that >[/quote]

Back when I started building computers AMD was better and cheaper than intel. But isn’t it the case now that intel is better and cheaper than AMD?

Read full topic

item.title: Intel with ATI
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:22, topic:284038”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=375398.msg2835344#msg2835344 date=1245612099]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=375398.msg2835315#msg2835315 date=1245610222]

Just remember: You will need a good PSU to handle a good video card.

750W

400W minimum.
[/quote]This. They usually trick you with the minimum requirements when buying a new graphics card.

Wait a second, so when it says 750W, a 400W will work fine? (I have a 485W)
[/quote]Well, i have a cheap ass 500W psu and 1 of my cards require minimum 500W[/quote]

Apparantly, the cards only use like ~180 Watts of power, the rest is CPU, RAM and HDD usage

Read full topic

item.title: Intel with ATI
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

For my main desktop, I have decided to never go Intel for the CPU, even though they are better in people’s opinions. Also, I have just made the Change from nVidia(8600GT) to ATi(X1900GT) and so far, I have to say nVidia is the better of them. Also, I would state as a generalisation that ATi cards are larger than the nVidia ones, so if you want to save space, use the nVidia.

Just remember: You will need a good PSU to handle a good video card.

Read full topic

item.title: Intel with ATI
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

these Nvidia fanbois are going a little over the top.

Don’t get me wrong i use nvidia and have always supported them, but being a hardcore computer enthusiast and ‘down’ with anything happening in the internet world, don’t just listen to what people tell you.

ATI and AMD right now are the smarter choice in price & performance. Nvidia & Intel are priced a little higher, but have the higher end products (not by much). Anything you mix and match will work fine, a lot of people on these forums seem to dislike ATI and my guess is they know shit all about what they are talking about. ATI were quite shit for a long time, everyone choose Nvidia before ATI’s 48xx series came out.

ATIs 4870, 4890 and 2x 4770’s is a very good choice for price and performance. Unfortunately games such as Crysis that have an affiliation with Nvidia are benchmark biased by a good 20%. In other games they are about the same.

Intel are great in their 45nm series of core 2 duo’s, sold Q6600s like hotcakes, and currently provide the best CPU’s around (that come at a price) whilst AMD provide you cheap CPU’s that only lose about 10% performance to intel’s higher performance.

I love anyone who provides quality and price, i love all these brands and if you really want the real facts go to any proper computing forum. asking regular’s won’t give you shit all details except their personal experiences.

Read full topic

I’m not a big linux user when it comes to desktops, just for laptops.
I figure it should be a great card for me.[/quote]
Oh, I was not aware you were talking about CPU/GPU combo. That doesn’t effect each other.

item.title: Intel with ATI
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Holic:

ATI vs NVidia aside, can anyone answer the original question. Is there actually a disadvantage to mixing Intel and ATI?

I don’t think there are any disadvantages, they all implement a standard (PCIE, AGP etc) and will function just as well as any other that implements the same standard. Back when AMD CPUs were superior to Intel I always used AMD and Nvidia, my friend always used AMD and ATI (before the ‘merger’), now I stick with Intel and Nvidia, others use ATI but I find Nvidia driver quality to be better, and since I use linux 99% of the time it is the only way to go for me.

Bottom line, any CPU / GPU combo should work fine together, as they really have nothing to do with each other.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Holic:

ATI vs NVidia aside, can anyone answer the original question. Is there actually a disadvantage to mixing Intel and ATI?

no but you would probably get better performance if you did AMD + ATI

item.title: Intel with ATI
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:3, topic:284038”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=375398.msg2828998#msg2828998 date=1245258400]
ATI suck just buy an Nvidia card
[/quote]
QFT, Just do what Sanga says

ATI Card and Linux do not mix either because of the lack of drivers and driver support while Nvidia have excellent Linux drivers and support.[/quote]
Second point is very true.

ATI is a subdivision of AMD, if I am not mistaken. Intel chips are always better. The only AMD (processor) I’d ever use would be the Phenom II (if I needed a good, cheap chip & had an AMD Socket motherboard).

Read full topic

item.title: Intel with ATI
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

sanga282:

ATI suck just buy an Nvidia card

Yet the ATI Radeon HD 4870 beats the NVidia GTX 260, and is only 4 frames slower than the NVidia GTX 280 and $100 cheaper.

Don’t give this bullshit fanboy nonsense.

I know Fat Cookies is right to a point, what with bad Linux drivers, but ATI has made some significant improvements with their line of work. Everything seems to have had a revamp, so I’m hoping they’ll redo their Linux drivers. Plus this is for gaming, I’ll be using windows for the most part so that is no concern.

Read full topic
